turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Okay, you're attacked by the Bog Demon. Go ahead.

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: Uh, fourteen.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Doesn't count.  You gotta say the words.

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: This is stupid.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: C'mon.

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: In the name of Elric, Prince of Elves, demon begone.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Good.  You conquer the demon, but your horse is sinking in the bog.  What do you do?

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: I go to bed and get a new horse in the morning.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Why is he after us?

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: Yeah?  What did we ever do?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Mom and Dad?  That's...crazy.  They never said...

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: Oh sure.  That's just the sorta thing parents tell their kids:  "Goodnight honey.  Don't forget ot say your prayers. Oh, by the way, your father and I torched some maniac last night."

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: We're here.

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: Where...here?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I'm in.

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: Me too.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: Hi.  Good Lord -- you're the spitting image of...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I wonder if you could tell me where the...?

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: Oh, it's just down the corridor on the right.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: What do you think of the guinea fowl?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I'm a vegetarian.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: Oh God.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Lovely to meet you.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: And you.  I'll wait till you've gone before I tell him you're a vegetarian.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Wait a minute.  What about me?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm sorry?  You think you deserve the brownie?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Well... a shot at it.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: That was such a great evening.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm delighted.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: And may I say that's a gorgeous tie.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Now you're lying.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You're right.  I told you I was bad at acting.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Night, night, Honey.

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: We are living in cloudcuckooland -- we'll never get this done today.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: We have to.  I've got to be in New York on Thursday.

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: Oh, stop showing off.

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: God, that's an enormous arse.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I'm not listening.

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: No, but seriously -- it's not fair -- so many tragic young teenagers with anorexia -- and that girl has an arse she could perfectly well share round with at least ten other women -- and still be beg-bottomed.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I said I'm not listening -- and I think, looking at something that firm, you and your droopy little excuse for an 'arse' would be well-advised to keep quiet.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: So I ask you when you're going to tell everyone, and you say...?

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: 'Tomorrow will be soon enough.'

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: And then I... right.

turns.speaker: JAMES
turns.text: Who was that rather difficult chap you were talking to on the way up?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Oh... no one... no one.  Just some... guy from the past.  I don't know what he's doing here.  Bit of an awkward situation.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: So tell me Anna -- what do you do?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I'm an actress.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Splendid.  I'm actually in the stock- market, so not really similar fields, though I have done some amateur stuff -- P.G. Wodehouse, you know -- farce, all that.  'Ooh -- careful there, vicar.'  Always imagined it's a pretty tough job, though, acting. I mean the wages are a scandal, aren't they?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Well, they can be.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: I see friends from university -- clever chaps -- been in the business longer than you -- they're scraping by on seven, eight thousand a year. It's no life.  What sort of acting do you do?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Films mainly.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Oh splendid.  Well done.  How's the pay in movies?  I mean, last film you did, what did you get paid?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Fifteen million dollars.

turns.speaker: BERNIE
turns.text: Right.  Right.  So that's... fairly good.  On the high side... have you tried the nuts?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: No, thanks.  I'll just look around.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: That book's really not good -- just in case, you know, browsing turned to buying.  You'd be wasting your money.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Yes.  This one though is... very good.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I think the man who wrote it has actually been to Turkey, which helps. There's also a very amusing incident with a kebab.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Thanks.  I'll think about it.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Sorry about that...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: No, that's fine.  I was going to steal one myself but now I've changed my mind.  Signed by the author, I see.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Yes, we couldn't stop him.  If you can find an unsigned copy, it's worth an absolute fortune.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Oh Jesus.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Here, let me help.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Nothing, nothing... Look, I live just over the street -- you could get cleaned up.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: No thank you.  I need to get my car back.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I also have a phone.  I'm confident that in five minutes we can have you spick and span and back on the street again... in the non-prostitute sense obviously.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Okay.  So what does 'just over the street' mean -- give it to me in yards.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Eighteen yards.  That's my house there.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Would you like a cup of tea before you go?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: No thanks.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Coffee?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Orange juice -- probably not.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Something else cold -- coke, water, some disgusting sugary drink pretending to have something to do with fruits of the forest?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Really, no.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Would you like something to nibble -- apricots, soaked in honey -- quite why, no one knows -- because it stops them tasting of apricots, and makes them taste like honey, and if you wanted honey, you'd just buy honey, instead of apricots, but nevertheless -- there we go -- yours if you want them.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Do you always say 'no' to everything?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: No.  I better be going.  Thanks for your help.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: You're welcome and, may I also say... heavenly.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Yes.  Well.  My pleasure.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Oh hi.  Forget something?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I forgot my bag.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Oh right.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Here we go.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Thanks.  Well...

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I apologize for the 'surreal but nice' comment.  Disaster...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Don't worry about it.  I thought the apricot and honey business was the real lowpoint.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Probably best not tell anyone about this.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Right.  No one.  I mean, I'll tell myself sometimes but... don't worry -- I won't believe it.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Bye.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Hello.  Hi.  Hi.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Oh hi.  It's William Thacker.  We, ahm I work in a bookshop.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You played it pretty cool here, waiting for three days to call.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: No, I've never played anything cool in my entire life.  Spike, who I'll stab to death later, never gave me the message.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Oh -- Okay.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Perhaps I could drop round for tea or something?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Yeh -- unfortunately, things are going to be pretty busy, but... okay, let's give it a try.  Four o'clock could be good.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Right.  Great.  Classic.  Classic.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I brought these, but clearly...

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Sorry about not ringing back.  The whole two-names concept was totally too much for my flatman's pea-sized intellect.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: No, it's a stupid privacy thing.  I always choose a cartoon character -- last time out, I was Mrs. Bambi.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Right.  Ahm... the film's great... and I just wondered -- whether you ever thought of having more... horses in it?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Ahm -- well -- we would have liked to -- but it was difficult, obviously, being set in space.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Obviously.  Very difficult.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I'm sorry -- I arrived outside -- they thrust this thing into my hand -- I didn't know what to do.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: No, it's my fault, I thought this would all be over by now.  I just wanted to sort of apologize for the kissing thing.  I seriously don't know what got in to me.  I just wanted to make sure you were fine about it.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Absolutely fine about it.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I'm just a complete moron.  Sorry. This is the sort of thing that happens in dreams -- not in real life.  Good dreams, obviously -- it's a dream to see you.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: And what happens next in the dream?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Are you busy tonight?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Well, it was nice to meet you. Surreal but nice.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Thank you.  You are 'Horse and Hound's' favorite actress.  You and Black Beauty.  Tied.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Ahm.  That thing I was doing tonight -- I'm not doing it any more.  I told them I had to spend the evening with Britain's premier equestrian journalist.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Oh well, great.  Perfect.  Oh no -- shittity brickitty -- it's my sister's birthday -- shit -- we're meant to be having dinner.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Okay -- fine.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: But no, I'm sure I can get out of it.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: No, I mean, if it's fine with you, I'll, you know, be your date.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: You'll be my date at my little sister's birthday party?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: If that's all right.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I'm sure it's all right.  My friend Max is cooking and he's acknowledged to be the worst cook in the world, but you know, you could hide the food in your handbag or something.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: You'll have to prove it.  This is a great brownie and I'm going to fight for it.  State your claim.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Well, I've been on a diet since I was nineteen, which means basically I've been hungry for a decade.  I've had a sequence of not nice boyfriends -- one of whom hit me: and every time my heart gets broken it gets splashed across the newspapers as entertainment. Meantime, it cost millions to get me looking like this...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Floppy, huh?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: It's the hair!  It's to do with the hair.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Why is she in a wheelchair?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: It was an accident -- about eighteen months ago.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: And the pregnancy thing -- is that to do with the accident?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: You know, I'm not sure.  I don't think they'd tried for kids before, as fate would have it.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Too complicated.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: That's fine.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Busy tomorrow?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I thought you were leaving.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I was.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Gardens.  All these streets round here have these mysterious communal gardens in the middle of them. They're like little villages.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Let's go in.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Ah no -- that's the point -- they're private villages -- only the people who live round the edges are allowed in.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You abide by rules like that?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Ahm...

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Whoopsidaisies.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: What did you say?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Yes, you did.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: No, I didn't.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You said 'whoopsidaisies.'

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I don't think so.  No one has said 'whoopsidaisies,' do they -- I mean unless they're...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: There's no 'unless.'  No one has said "whoopsidaisies" for fifty years and even then it was only little girls with blonde ringlets.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Exactly.  Here we go again.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: It's a disease I've got -- it's a clinical thing.  I'm taking pills and having injections -- it won't last long.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Step aside.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: So who left who?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: She left me.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: She saw through me.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Uh-oh.  That's not good.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: No, that's fine.  I love that you tried... time was I'd have done the same.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I shouldn't have done that.  I shouldn't have done that.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: No, you were brilliant

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I'm rash and I'm stupid and what am I doing with you?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I don't know, I'm afraid.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I don't know either.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Here we are.  Do you want to come up?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: There seem to be lots of reasons why I shouldn't.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: There are lots of reasons.  Do you want to come up?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: To be able to do that is such a wonderful thing.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You've got to go.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Because my boyfriend, who I thought was in America, is in fact in the next room.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Your boyfriend?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: -- this is a fairly strange reality to be faced with.  To be honest, I don't realize...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I'm sorry... I don't know what to say.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I think goodbye is traditional.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Hi.  Can I come in?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Come in.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I don't know where to go.  The hotel is surrounded.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: This is the place.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Thank you.  I'm just in London for two days -- but, with your papers, it's the worse place to be.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: These are such horrible pictures. They're so grainy... they make me look like...

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Don't think about it.  We'll sort it out.  Now what would you like -- tea ... bath...?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: A bath would be great.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I'm really sorry about last time.  He just flew in -- I had no idea -- in fact, I had no idea if he'd ever fly in again.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: No, that's fine.  It's not often one has the opportunity to adios the plates of a major Hollywood star.  It was a thrill for me.  How is he?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I don't know.  It got to the point where I couldn't remember any of the reasons I loved him.  And you... and love?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Well, there's a question -- without an interesting answer.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I have thought about you.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Oh no no -- no.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Just anytime I've tried to keep things normal with anyone normal -- it's been a disaster.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I appreciate that absolutely.  Is that the film you're doing?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Yes -- start in L.A. on Tuesday.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Would you like me to take you through your lines?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Would you?  It's all talk, talk, talk.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Hand it over.  Basic plot?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I'm a difficult but brilliant junior officer who in about twenty minutes will save the world from nuclear disaster.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Well done you.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: 'Message from command.  Would you like them to send in the HKs?'

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: 'No, turn over 4 TRS's and tell them we need radar feedback before the KFT's return at 19 hundred -- then inform the Pentagon that we'll be needing black star cover from ten hundred through 12.15' -- and don't you dare say one word about how many mistakes I made in that speech or I'll pelt you with olives.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: 'Very well, captain -- I'll pass that on straightaway.'

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: 'Thank you.'  How many mistake did I make?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Eleven.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Damn.  'And Wainwright...'

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Cartwright.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: 'Cartwright, Wainwright, whatever your name is, I promised little Jimmy I'd be home for his birthday -- could you get a message through that I may be a little late.'

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: 'Certainly.  And little Johnny?'

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: My son's name is Johnny?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Yup.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Well, get a message through to him too.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Brilliant.  Word perfect I'd say.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Gripping.  It's not Jane Austen, it's not Henry James, but it's gripping.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You think I should do Henry James instead?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I'm sure you'd be great in Henry James. But, you know -- this writer's pretty damn good too.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Yes -- I mean -- you never get anyone in 'Wings of a Dove' having the nerve to say 'inform the Pentagon that we need black star cover.'

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: And I think the book is the poorer for it.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: You like Chagall?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I do.  It feels like how being in love should be.  Floating through a dark blue sky.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: With a goat playing a violin.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Yes -- happiness wouldn't be happiness without a violin-playing goat.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You've got big feet.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Yes.  Always have had.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You know what they say about men with big feet?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: No.  What's that?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Big feet -- large shoes.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: The thing that's so irritating is that now I'm so totally fierce when it comes to nudity clauses.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: You actually have clauses in your contact about nudity?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Definitely.  'You may show the dent at the top of the artist's buttocks -- but neither cheek.  In the event of a stunt person being used, the artist must have full consultation.'

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: You have a stunt bottom?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I could have a stunt bottom, yes.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Would you be tempted to go for a slightly better bottom than your own?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Definitely.  Ths is important stuff.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: It's one hell of a job.  What do you put on your passport?  Profession -- Mel Gibson's bottom.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Actually, Mel does his own ass work. Why wouldn't he?  It's delicious.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: The ice cream or Mel Gibson's bottom?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Both.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Today has ben a good day.  Which under the circumstances is... unexpected.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Well, thank you.  Anyway -- time for bed.  Or... sofa-bed.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Oh please sod off.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: No! No.  Wait.  I... thought you were someone else.  I thought you were Spike. I'm delighted you're not.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Wow.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: It still strikes me as, well, surreal, that I'm allowed to see you naked.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You and every person in this country.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Oh God yes -- I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: What is it about men and nudity? Particularly breasts -- how can you be so interested in them?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: No seriously.  I mean, they're just breasts.  Every second person in the world has got them...

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: More than that actually, when you think about it.  You know, Meatloaf has a very nice pair...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: But... they're odd-looking.  They're for milk.  Your mum's got them.  You must have seen a thousand of them -- what's the fuss about?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Actually, I can't think really -- let me just have a quick look...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Rita Hayworth used to say -- 'they go to bed with Gilda -- they wake up with me.' Do you feel that?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Who was Gilda?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Her most famous part -- men went to bed with the dream -- and they didn't like it when they woke up with the reality -- do you feel that way with me?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: You're lovelier this morning than you have ever been.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Can I stay a bit longer?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Stay forever.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Damn, I forgot the jam.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Don't ask.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Oh my God.  And they got a photo of you dressed like that?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Undressed like this, yes.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Jesus.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: How are you doing?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: How do you think I'm doing?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I don't know what happened.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I do.  Your furry friend thought he'd make a buck or two telling the papers where I was.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: That's not true.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Really?  The entire British press just woke up this morning and thought 'Hey -- I know where Anna Scott is.  She's in that house with the blue door in Notting Hill.'  And then you go out in your goddamn underwear.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: This is such a mess.  I come to you to protect myself against more crappy gossip and now I'm landed in it all over again.  For God's sake, I've got a boyfriend.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: You do?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: As far as they're concerned I do.  And now tomorrow there'll be pictures of you in every newspapers from here to Timbuktu.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I know, I know -- but... just -- let's stay calm...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You can stay calm -- it's the perfect situation for you -- minimum input, maximum publicity.  Everyone you ever bump into will know.  'Well done you -- you slept with that actress -- we've seen the pictures.'

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: That's spectacularly unfair.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Who knows, it may even help business. Buy a boring book about Egypt from the guy who screwed Anna Scott.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Now stop.  Stop.  I beg you -- calm down. Have a cup of tea.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I don't want a goddamn cup of tea.  I want to go home.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: And remember -- Spike owes you an expensive dinner.  Or holiday -- depending if he's got the brains to get the going rate on betrayal.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: That's not true.  And wait a minute... this is crazy behavior.  Can't we just laugh about this?  Seriously -- in the huge sweep of things, this stuff doesn't matter.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You're right: of course, you're right. It's just that I've dealt with this garbage for ten years now -- you've had it for ten minutes.  Our perspectives are different.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I mean -- today's newspapers will be lining tomorrow's waste paper bins.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Well, you know -- it's just one day. Today's papers will all have been thrown away tomorrow.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You really don't get it.  This story gets filed.  Every time anyone writes anything about me -- they'll dig up these photos.  Newspapers last forever. I'll regret this forever.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: This is certainly... ah...

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I only found out you were here yesterday.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I was going to ring... but... I didn't think you'd want to...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: It's not going very well -- and it's our last day.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Absolutely -- you're clearly very busy.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: But... wait... there are things to say.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Drink tea -- there's lots of tea.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You disappeared.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Yes -- I'm sorry -- I had to leave... I didn't want to disturb you.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Well... how have you been?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Fine.  Everything much the same.  When they change the law Spike and I will marry immediately.  Whereas you... I've watched in wonder.  Awards, glory ...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Oh no.  It's all nonsense, believe me. I had no idea how much nonsense it all was -- but nonsense it all is...  Well, yesterday was our last day filming and so I'm just off -- but I brought you this from home, and...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I thought I'd give it to you.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Thank you.  Shall I...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: No, don't open it yet -- I'll be embarrassed.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Okay -- well, thank you.  I don't know what it's for.  But thank you anyway.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I actually had it in my apartment in New York and just thought you'd... but, when it came to it, I didn't know how to call you... having behaved so... badly, twice.  So it's been just sitting in the hotel.  But then... you came, so I figured... the thing is... the thing is ...

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: What's the thing?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: You were saying...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Yes.  The thing is... I have to go away today but I wondered, if I didn't, whether you might let me see you a bit... or, a lot maybe... see if you could... like me again.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: But yesterday... that actor asked you who I was... and you just dismissed me out of hand... I heard -- you had a microphone... I had headphones.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: You expect me to tell the truth about my life to the most indiscreet man in England?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: Sorry about that.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: That's fine.  There's always a pause when the jury goes out to consider its verdict.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: ... can I just say 'no' to your kind request and leave it at that?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: ... Yes, that's fine.  Of course.  I... you know... of course... I'll just... be getting along then... nice to see you.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: The truth is...

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: ... with you, I'm in real danger.  It took like a perfect situation, apart from that foul temper of yours -- but my relatively inexperienced heart would, I fear, not recover if I was once again ... cast aside, which I would absolutely expect to be.  There are too many pictures of you everywhere, too many films.  You'd go and I'd be... well, buggered, basically.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I see.  That reality is a real 'no,' isn't it?

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: I live in Notting Hill.  You live in Beverly Hills.  Everyone in the world knows who you are.  My mother has trouble remembering my name.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Okay.  Fine.  Fine.  Good decision.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I hoped there might be -- but no, I'm assured there aren't.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: And what would you say...

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Yes, I'm pretty sure I would.

turns.speaker: WILLIAM
turns.text: That's very good news.  The readers of 'Horse and Hound' will be absolutely delighted.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Really -- don't do that -- I'm sure this is not his job.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: I'm sorry.  Is this a problem?

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Thank you, Bernie.  Hey -- nice surprise, or nasty surprise?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Nice surprise.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Liar.  She hates surprises.  What are you ordering?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I haven't decided.

turns.speaker: JEFF
turns.text: Well, don't over-do it.  I don't want people saying, 'There goes that famous actor with the big, fat girlfriend."

turns.speaker: THIEF
turns.text: Excuse me.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: THIEF
turns.text: Can I have your autograph?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: What's your name?

turns.speaker: THIEF
turns.text: Rufus.

turns.speaker: THIEF
turns.text: What does it say?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Well, that's the signature -- and above, it says 'Dear Rufus -- you belong in jail.'

turns.speaker: THIEF
turns.text: Nice one.  Would you like my phone number?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Tempting but... no, thank you.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Can I just say, I thought 'Ghost' was a wonderful film.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Is that right?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Yes... I've always wondered what Patrick Swayze is like in real life.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I can't say I know Patrick all that well.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Oh dear.  He wasn't friendly during the filming?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Well, no -- I'm sure he was friendly -- to Demi Moore -- who acted with him in 'Ghost.'

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: He's bringing a girl?

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: Miracles do happen.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Does the girl have a name?

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: He wouldn't say.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Christ, what is going on in there?

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: And this is William.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Down Kensington Church Street, then Knightsbridge, then Hyde Park Corner.

turns.speaker: BELLA
turns.text: Crazy.  Go along Bayswater...
